message.content:
cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.CG, cs.DM, cs.GT. 

The paper deals with algorithmic questions related to graphs and tokens, which are typical topics in the sub-categories of cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.CC (Computational Complexity). The use of dynamic programming and the lower bound based on ETH (Exponential Time Hypothesis) also suggest cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics) as a likely sub-category. The problem of finding a shortest sequence of swaps can also be seen as a graph traversal problem, which is related to cs.CG (Computational Geometry). Finally, the mention of APX-hardness and approximation algorithms suggests cs.GT (Computer Science and Game Theory) as another possible sub-category.
